name: Quizness Time
description:
Quizness time is a free quiz platform. powered by Unity and the Open Trivia Database

At a time when everyone is forced to self isolate and people are looking for things to do, we decided to create a super-lightweight quiz hosting app that you can run on your computer, and stream to your friends, hosting your own virtual quiz nights.

All you have to do is download the game, run the app and then stream it to whoever you want. The way people answer the questions and scoring is down to you. Version 1.0 is barebones and we will add features based on how it is used and feedback.

How do I work it?

You act as the quiz master and stream it however you want!

  1. Download the zip and run the Quizness_Game.exe.
  2. Start your streaming service
  3. Select your category and amount of questions
  4. Hit start
  5. A text file will open with your answers, hide this from your viewers.
  6. Press next at your own pace
  7. When you run out of questions the game will return to the main screen

Keep score with somehting like Google Sheets, keepthescore.co or paper and pen

Here are some examples of how Quizness Time can be used:

Via Google Hangouts:

Start a hangouts with your friends and then share your screen. Answers can be sent via direct message. Keep score in a spread sheet or app

Facebook Live

Start a facebook live on your feed and have people directly message you the answers. Keep score in a spreadsheet or app

Twitch

You can stream via Twitch and use Direct Messages, Whisper or whatever for viewers to submit answers. Keep score in a spreadsheet or app. Maybe even write your own bot to keep score!

Local

If you are no longer in a self-isolating dystopia then host it at home on your tv or if you are a pub,. on all your TVs, projectors and use a pen and paper.

Other

Be creative! All you need to do is run Quizness Time somewhere and find people to answer your questions!

You can also setup the game to run your own MP3 files. Where you have unzipped the game open the Quizness_Game_Data folder then Streaming Assets the Music and copy any MP3 files in there (only MP3 are supported at this time).
